document.discussion_title: Braves rally past Nats in extras
document.topic_text: Peterson's homer in 10th sends Braves past Nationals 26 Atlanta, GA, USA; Atlanta Braves second baseman Jace Peterson (8) (far right) reacts with team mates after hitting a walk off home run against the Washington Nationals during the tenth inning at Turner Field. The Braves defeated the Nationals 7-6 in ten innings. Mandatory Credit: Dale Zanine- Dale Zanine, Dale Zanine) ATLANTA (AP) - Jace Peterson hit a tiebreaking homer in the 10th inning off Shawn Kelley, giving the Atlanta Braves a 7-6 victory over the Washington Nationals on Sunday. Rain delayed the game 1 hour, 4 minutes in the bottom of the eighth. Kelley (1-2) hung his head and walked toward the dugout as soon as Peterson made contact with his seventh homer. Kelley gave up one hit and one run in two-thirds of an inning. Jose Ramirez (1-0) faced four batters in the 10th to earn the win. Four of Washington's five errors led to runs for the Braves.
